unnormalised: ## Return Policies: May Lord Ganesha Help You!
normalised: Return Policies: May Lord Ganesha Help You!

unnormalised: Let’s be honest, folks. Return policies are the *ladoos* of the retail world – sweet to have, but sometimes leave you with a stomach ache. We’ve all been there. You order that fabulous Anarkali suit online, envisioning yourself as the next Madhuri Dixit, only to find it looks more like a potato sack on arrival. Sigh.
normalised: Let's be honest, folks. Return policies are the ladoos of the retail world – sweet to have, but sometimes leave you with a stomach ache. We've all been there. You order that fabulous Anarkali suit online, envisioning yourself as the next Madhuri Dixit, only to find it looks more like a potato sack on arrival. Sigh.

unnormalised: Navigating the return maze in India can feel like traversing the Chandni Chowk bazaar during Diwali – chaotic and full of surprises. Each shop, from your local Kirana store to the sprawling Reliance Digital, has its own set of rules. Some are as clear as the Ganges on a good day, others as murky as the Yamuna during monsoon.
normalised: Navigating the return maze in India can feel like traversing the Chandni Chowk bazaar during Diwali – chaotic and full of surprises. Each shop, from your local Kirana store to the sprawling Reliance Digital, has its own set of rules. Some are as clear as the Ganges on a good day, others as murky as the Yamuna during monsoon.

unnormalised: Remember that time I tried returning a pressure cooker to a store in Karol Bagh? They claimed I'd used it (apparently, looking at it intensely counts) and refused a refund! The store owner, Mr. Sharma, was adamant. "Return only possible if untouched, like brand new from factory!" he thundered. I swear I only opened the box to admire its shiny surface.
normalised: Remember that time I tried returning a pressure cooker to a store in Karol Bagh? They claimed I'd used it (apparently, looking at it intensely counts) and refused a refund! The store owner, Mister Sharma, was adamant. "Return only possible if untouched, like brand new from factory!" he thundered. I swear I only opened the box to admire its shiny surface.

unnormalised: The problem? The fine print. Return policies are often buried deeper than a treasure in Rajasthan’s Thar Desert. Don't skip reading it, even if it looks longer than a CBSE textbook. Understand the timelines (7 days? 14 days?), the conditions (tags intact? Original packaging?), and the acceptable reasons (faulty product? Wrong size? Sudden existential crisis?).
normalised: The problem? The fine print. Return policies are often buried deeper than a treasure in Rajasthan's Thar Desert. Don't skip reading it, even if it looks longer than a C B S E textbook. Understand the timelines (seven days? fourteen days?), the conditions (tags intact? Original packaging?), and the acceptable reasons (faulty product? Wrong size? Sudden existential crisis?).

unnormalised: Pro tip: ALWAYS, I repeat, ALWAYS keep the invoice. Losing it is like losing your Aadhar card – a bureaucratic nightmare. And while “didn't like it” might fly at a swanky boutique in Bandra, your local general store owner might just raise an eyebrow and offer you a cup of chai instead of a refund of Rs. 500.
normalised: Pro tip: ALWAYS, I repeat, ALWAYS keep the invoice. Losing it is like losing your Aadhar card – a bureaucratic nightmare. And while “didn't like it” might fly at a swanky boutique in Bandra, your local general store owner might just raise an eyebrow and offer you a cup of chai instead of a refund of rupees five hundred.

unnormalised: E-commerce sites, like Flipkart and Amazon, are generally better. But even they can have quirks. Did you try returning that 50 sq ft rug you ordered and discovered the return shipping cost was higher than the rug itself? Ouch.
normalised: E-commerce sites, like Flipkart and Amazon, are generally better. But even they can have quirks. Did you try returning that fifty square feet rug you ordered and discovered the return shipping cost was higher than the rug itself? Ouch.

unnormalised: So, before you click that "buy" button, pray to Lord Ganesha, read the return policy carefully, and hope for the best. Because sometimes, returning an item feels harder than cracking the IIT-JEE exam. Good luck, and may your returns be accepted without hassle! Dr. Kumar signing off.
normalised: So, before you click that "buy" button, pray to Lord Ganesha, read the return policy carefully, and hope for the best. Because sometimes, returning an item feels harder than cracking the I I T-J E E exam. Good luck, and may your returns be accepted without hassle! Doctor Kumar signing off.
